Class ProductController

java.lang.Object
com.example.wgusoftware1.ProductController
public class ProductController extends Object
The controller class for the Product view.

  • Method Details

    • setup

      public void setup(com.example.wgusoftware1.Product product)
      The setup method accepts a product and populates the scene with the product's data.
      Parameters:
      product - The product to be displayed on the scene.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller after its root element has been completely processed. This method sets up the table views and columns with the appropriate cell value factories. It also initializes the product ID and the used parts list.

    • removePart

      public void removePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Remove a selected part from the used parts table view and from the list of associated parts for the product being edited/created. Repopulate the used parts table view.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered this method.

    • cancel

      public void cancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Cancels adding a new product and returns to the main Inventory Management System screen. Prompts the user to confirm the cancellation before navigating back to the main screen.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent object representing the user's click on the cancel button
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during the loading of the FXML file for the main screen

    • save

      public void save(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Saves the information entered into the AddProduct view and adds or updates the Product in the Inventory. If the required information is missing or invalid, displays an error message. If a Product with the same ID already exists in the Inventory, updates the existing Product. Otherwise, adds the new Product to the Inventory. Upon successful save, navigates back to the main InventoryManagementSystem view.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered this method.
